cRefPattern.p: This pattern references a specific line.
This pattern references an inscribed surface.
This pattern references a specific artefact, usually a tablet.

div.l: [...] LUH#? x [...] dingir#? ⸢na⸣-⸢me⸣ ⸢e⸣-ne-gin7 nu-mu-ni-in-dim2 [...]
[...] ⸢ba⸣-an-gi4 gal-an-zu geštux(|GIŠ.TUG2|)#!? bad a-ra2 sag2 ka ba-ni x [...]
[...] x ⸢muš3⸣ hi-li su3 TAB-NIG2 sikil-⸢la⸣ alan nir-nir alan gar-ra x [...]
[...] x me-lam2-ma hu-hu-ul su3#?-ag2#?-bi u4-gin7 i-lim kar2-kar2 [...]
[...] x mah me-te e2 an-ka#? dingir ⸢gal⸣-gal-e-ne-er geš-la2-ni x [...]
[sag]-⸢en3⸣-tar barax(|BARA2xIGI|)-bara2-ke4-ne inim-ma-ni gu2-an an-ki-a za3 nu-ša4 TUR MUŠ3 [...]
[...] x DU? ur-sag AN sa2-e KA lagar? ku3 a2? ⸢ag2⸣ igi zu-zu x x [...] ga2? [...]
[...] di? u6 di du7-a me-dim2-⸢bi⸣ la-la gur3 sukud sa6-ge#? [...] nu#?-ub!?-du11
[du11]-ga dugud ša3#? ⸢bar⸣ tam-me inim u3#!?-tu tak4 ad-hal an-ki ša3 an me nun [...]-⸢sa6⸣
ka#?-mud-gal2 kingal {d}a-nun-na-ke4-ne {d}en-ki? ku3-zu nig2-nam [...] ⸢sag⸣-e-eš ⸢rig7⸣-[...]
⸢za3⸣-e3 nun-gal-e-ne umun2#? diri dab e-ne-da nu {d}en-lil2#?-le#? dingir gal-gal-e-ne-er a2 ag2 nu-šum2-šum2-⸢mu⸣
dingir#? zi ki ag2 an ku3-ga du5?-e geš tuku uri3#? zi-⸢ša3⸣-gal2#?-ka#? ti-le-de3 ki ⸢ag2⸣ [...]
{d#}nin-⸢šubur⸣ en {d}lammax(DAG)-{d#}lammax(DAG) dingir-še3 tuku arhuš ša3 gur#!?-ru mu-un-zu-a lugal-gu10-ur2 ⸢u3⸣-[ne-de3-tah]
ša3#? {d}inanna inim sa6-ge ⸢igi⸣ an ku3-ga-še3!? ka ba-ni dingir gal-gal-e-ne gizzal im-[...]
[{geš}]gidri il2 a2 ag2 di-ir-ga za3 keš2 muš3 ad gal2-bi ul hi-li inim? gun3
[...] GIRI16 me-ni me-ta šen a-ra2 galam-ma-bi mah dab?-ba kilib3-še3 nig2-⸢nam⸣ x x x [...]
[...] {d#}nin-šubur ⸢ša3⸣ ⸢kuš2⸣-u3 {d}inanna šul-a-lum du8-du8 šu-a-ra mur gig-ga sag x [...]
[...] x [...] ⸢geš⸣ tuku inim sa6-ge-bi nu-kar2-kar2 nam-tag#? [...]
[...] x x ⸢zi⸣-zi lugal#?-gu10#?-ur2#? ⸢u3⸣-ne-⸢de3⸣-[peš]
..., no (other) god acts like him
..., wise (with his) responses, open minded one, (his) way <cannot be?> dispersed(!?), his utterance ...
... (possessor of a) face exuding allure, pure ..., stretched-out form(?), a statue(?) inlaid with(?) ...
... in an aura, lighting up with an aura brightly like the day
Supreme ..., ornament of the temple of An(?), for the great gods his (attentive) silence(?) ...
Supervisor of the (mortal) rulers, his word is unreachable within the heights(?) of the universe, ...
... hero, god who regularly (furnishes offerings!?) ..., holy lagar vizier(?), bringing attention to the command(?) ...
... suitable for admiration, whose limbs bearing happiness ..., a beautiful stature that has not(?) ...

Examining the content of important speech(?) (and then) begets (additional) words (i.e., revises?) while leaving (the message intact), who betters(?) the secret of the universe (which reside?) in the mind of An(?), and the foremost cosmic powers
Advocate and kingal overseer of the Anuna gods, who was bestowed knowledge of everything by Enki
Foremost of the great princes (Igigi), (possessing) excessive and surpassing knowledge, without him An and Enlil(?) do not issue orders to the great gods
True god, beloved by holy An, paying attention to ...(?), guardian of life-giving force who loves to sustain(?), ...
Ninšubur, lord whom the lamma protective spirits have as (their) (personal) god(?), who has known compassion and mercy, to my king, when you repeat(?) to him
Putting a good word to the heart of Inanna, before An the great gods have paid attention to(?) his utterance
Raising the scepter, issuing commands, clad in(?) the ritual arrangements(?), his(?) advice giving(?) face charming(?) with pleasure and allure
..., his cosmic powers are purer than (other) cosmic powers(?), (its) skillful way/decree supremely surpassing(?), ... in totality everything ...
Holy? Ninšubur, taking counsel (with) Inanna, undoing punshment, the one “struck upon the hand,” murgig disease(?) ...
... listening to ..., his(!) praying/good words never disparaging(?), ... sin(?)
... when you (say it) a 3rd time(?) to my king
